# NonCompart R Package

## 이 장에서는

We will see what `NonCompart` [@R-NonCompart] is and how it works.

## What is `NonCompart` R package?

Description: Conduct a noncompartmental analysis as closely as possible to the most widely used commercial software for pharmacokinetic analysis, i.e. 'Phoenix(R) WinNonlin(R)' <https://www.certara.com/software/pkpd-modeling-and-simulation/phoenix-winnonlin/>. [@gab]

Some features are

1. CDISC SDTM terms
2. Automatic slope selection with the same criterion of WinNonlin(R)
3. Supporting both 'linear-up linear-down' and 'linear-up log-down' method
4. Interval(partial) AUCs with 'linear' or 'log' interpolation method
